class_notes: Science Writing for Scientific Audiences - In this course, students will practice clear, analytical writing about science for professional and academic settings. Students will critique scientific papers, visualize data, present research talks, and facilitate scientific conversations. Students will also work on metacognitive skills such as tracking their time labor and writing with the goal of revising. This class is designed for students who have completed at least introductory level courses in some of the natural sciences. This course is not focused on writing about science for the public.
course_description: Course topics will vary but always will be focused on writing, rhetorical composition and analysis, or literacy skills. Topics possible include a variety of options such as journalistic writing, non-fiction, debate, argumentation, persuasion, digital writing, among others.
